issue.title: Trying to run bitcoin qt on Windows and getting an AV
issue.body:

Follow the MSVC compilation process on Windows 11 23H2

events.body: Not sure what to do here. Are there steps for debugging? @hebasto given this is Qt on Windows.

So far unable to recreate on Win 11. Installing the 23H2 update and will try again.

Update:

Still unable to recreate. Host = Win 11 Pro 23H2, VS2022 17.11.2

Steps performed:

```shell
rm -force C:\Users\max\AppData\Local\vcpkg\
rm build
cmake -B build --preset vs2022-static
cmake --build build --config Release -j 20
ctest --test-dir build --build-config Release -j 20
```

@danilotg are these the same steps as yourself and can you give any more information?
It would also be good to confirm the exact commit hash where this happened, because `master` may have changed when it was pulled and when the issue was filed (and certainly has changed now).

I can confirm the issue for the both `x64-windows` and `x64-windows-static` triplets.

~All test pass for the `x64-windows-static` triplet.~

@danilotg 

What happens if you set the `QT_QPA_PLATFORM` environment variable to "windows"?

The reason of the issue is described in this comment: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/69409bc6e55848cf959ed924bcc722997455d76f/src/qt/test/CMakeLists.txt#L47-L48

And a mitigation follows: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/69409bc6e55848cf959ed924bcc722997455d76f/src/qt/test/CMakeLists.txt#L49-L51

That's why the issue is [not observable](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30825#issuecomment-2338560259) when running `ctest`.
